events.title: Weather tracker: Spain and Portugal hit by third deadly storm in two weeks
events.description: Storm Marta sweeps Iberian peninsula just days after Storms Kristin and Leonardo brought deadly flooding and major damage Spain and Portugal have endured another storm over the weekend, just days after the deadly flooding and major damage caused by Storm Kristin and Storm Leonardo last week. Storm Marta passed over the Iberian peninsula on Saturday, bringing fresh torrential rain and killing two people. Storm Kristin killed at least five people after it made landfall on 28 January with Storm Leonardo claiming another victim last Wednesday . The outlook for this week is for more rain across Spain, Portugal and France, especially across north-west Portugal, where more than 100mm is possible during the first half of the week. Some of the heaviest of the rain will transfer to southern Italy and western parts of Greece and Turkey later in the week. Continue reading...

events.title: Australia politics live: Murray Watt takes aim at volume of Senate estimates questions as Greens senator laments lack of ‚Äòtimely answers‚Äô
events.description: Follow the latest news live Sydney protest: NSW premier defends police in ‚Äòimpossible situation‚Äô after accusations of violence against protesters Get our breaking news email , free app or daily news podcast The NSW premier, Chris Minns , is making the first of multiple appearances across the media this morning following the violent clashes between police and protesters yesterday evening. He has told Channel Nine‚Äôs Today program that police were ‚Äúput in an impossible situation last night‚Äù: It‚Äôs worth remembering they did everything possible to avoid that confrontation, starting last week when they begged protest organisers to have it in Hyde Park, where it was safe and a march could take place. I know that some of the scenes on media are short clips, but people have to understand the circumstances where protesters breached police lines and ran amuck in Sydney would have been devastating. No. She‚Äôs wrong. I‚Äôm not going to throw police under the bus this morning. This is a situation that‚Äôs incredibly combustible. And the circumstances that weren‚Äôt shown on the news this morning or on TV last night because is what would have happened if protesters breached police lines ... It would have dangerous ‚Ä¶ as difficult as the scenes were to watch, it would have been infinitely worse if NSW police didn‚Äôt do their job last night. I think the - the protest organisers, when both the police and the courts said to them, yes, you can protest, but you can either do it in a stationary way here in Town Hall, if you want to march, you can march through a different part of the city, should have heeded that advice. But of course, some of the videos that we‚Äôve seen have been very concerning. And I expect they‚Äôll be investigated. Continue reading...

events.title: Jimmy Lai's evolution from Hong Kong media magnate to activist in photos
events.description: Prominent democracy advocate Jimmy Lai was a child stowaway from mainland China who rose to become Hong Kong‚Äôs onetime media magnate. Unlike other rags-to-riches tycoons who cultivated ties with Beijing, he chose to become its fierce critic. The 78-year-old founder of the now-defunct Apple Daily, a newspaper known for critical reports against both the Hong Kong and Beijing governments, was sentenced to 20 years in prison Monday for his conviction under a China-imposed national security law. Here are 10 key moments in Lai‚Äôs life showing his evolution from a clothing businessman to one of the city‚Äôs best-known pro-democracy activists. 1989: Tiananmen shifts path of clothing chain founder From a child laborer in a glove factory, Lai transformed himself into a clothing entrepreneur, founding the Giordano casual clothing chain in 1981. But the 1989 Tiananmen Square crackdown on pro-democracy protests in Beijing changes Lai‚Äôs path. Giordano prints T-shirts in support of the...

events.title: US seizes sanctioned oil tanker in Indian Ocean
events.description: The Pentagon says US forces boarded a Panamanian-flagged oil tanker that attempted to evade them after departing the Caribbean. It is not entirely clear if the vessel was tied to Venezuela's shadow fleet.
events.ticker_label: üí• US seizes sanctioned oil tanker in Indian Ocean

events.title: MSC braces for more of Trump's 'wrecking-ball politics'
events.description: Chairman Wolfgang Ischinger tells DW the 2026 Munich Security Conference comes when "obviously, trust has been damaged" by President Trump. But he also says US calls for a more "self-reliant" Europe are fair and overdue.

events.title: Ghislaine Maxwell avoids questions in House deposition
events.description: Maxwell chose to invoke the Fifth Amendment and stay silent in order to not incriminate herself. Democrats say Maxwell, an associate of Jeffrey Epstein, will not cooperate because she wants a pardon from Trump.

events.title: US Vice President Vance in Armenia for peace talks
events.description: Vice President JD Vance became the highest-ranking US politician ever to visit Armenia. He will travel to Azerbaijan on Tuesday in hopes of finalizing a peace deal kicked off in the White House last August.

events.title: Thailand: What's next after PM Anutin's big election win?
events.description: PM Anutin's Bhumjaithai party has defied expectations and won the most seats in the general election. The reformist People's Party struggled to define itself against the incumbents.
events.ticker_label: üí• Thailand: What's next after PM Anutin's big election win?

events.title: Fact check: Bad Bunny's Super Bowl halftime show sparks viral claims
events.description: Bad Bunny made history performing the Super Bowl halftime show in Spanish. Meanwhile, disinformation about the Puerto Rican singer goes viral. A DW fact check.

events.title: Japan election win improves Takaichi's foreign-policy hand
events.description: Reinstalled with a supermajority, Japanese leader Sanae Takaichi is likely to maintain a hard line on China while seeking even closer security and trade ties with the US.

events.title: Germany news: Carnival season set to generate ‚Ç¨2 billion
events.description: Economists predict that an unusually short carnival season will still deliver a significant economic boost. Meanwhile, the trial resumes of a mother accused of hiding her daughter away for seven years. DW has the latest.

events.title: US forces board sanctioned tanker after globe-spanning pursuit
events.description: US military forces have boarded a sanctioned oil tanker in the Indian Ocean after tracking it from the Caribbean, Defence Secretary Pete Hegseth said on Monday, marking a major escalation in the Trump administration‚Äôs campaign to enforce an oil quarantine on Venezuela and seize vessels accused of evading sanctions.

events.title: Japan's Iron Lady: What will Takaichi do with her landslide win?
events.description: Takaichi Sanae‚Äôs Liberal Democratic Party turning the wobbly coalition she inherited back in October as Japan‚Äôs first woman prime minister into a landslide win in snap elections that gives the 64-year old admirer of late British maverick prime minister Margaret Thatcher enough leeway to reform the constitution and break with eight decades of pacifism.

events.title: Sebastien Lai: Father's release must precede normalisation with UK, all nations 'who love freedom'
events.description: Nadia Massih is pleased to welcome Sebastien Lai, son of Hong Kong's media tycoon and pro‚Äëdemocracy activist Jimmy Lai. He describes his 78-year-old father, sentenced to 20 years in prison for challenging China's hardline system, as a man of conviction who stands fearlessly for truth, democracy, and human dignity. Lai's spirit remains intact despite his deteriorating health, says Sebastien. He challenges the UK and other democracies across the globe to stand by press freedom, civil rights, and justice, over diplomacy.

events.title: India: Justin Bieber ‚Äòlookalike‚Äô goes viral
events.description: üî•Suraj Chavan, known for his 2010s Bieber-style hair, has 4.5M followers and shot to fame after winning Bigg Boss Marathi S5 in 2024 ‚ú®He‚Äôs back in the headlines for calling himself India‚Äôs ‚Äúmost handsome man‚Äù, a claim disputed by several media outlets.IndianJustinBieber #BiggBossMarathi #ViralStar

events.title: Vance becomes first sitting US VP to visit Armenia in push to advance Azerbaijan peace deal
events.description: US Vice President JD Vance on Monday arrived in Armenia ahead of a planned visit to Azerbaijan as Washington seeks to consolidate the peace agreement it brokered between the two countries and advance a transit corridor project.

events.title: Have a baby while you still can, France to tell 29-year-olds
events.description: All 29-year-old French citizens are to be encouraged by their government to have babies while they still can.

events.title: Social media goes on trial in LA - here's what you need to know
events.description: Social media is on trial in Los Angeles. What happens next could change the way they operate.

events.title: Jimmy Lai jail term 'tantamount to life sentence', says UK foreign secretary
events.description: The UK foreign secretary has said a 20-year jail term handed down by a Hong Kong court to pro-democracy campaigner Jimmy Lai is "tantamount to a life sentence".

events.title: Wedding ceremony during Bad Bunny's Super Bowl half-time show was genuine
events.description: Yes, the wedding ceremony during Bad Bunny's historic Super Bowl half-time show - the first where a headliner performed entirely in Spanish - was genuine.

events.title: Tanzania opposition leader returns to court for treason trial after monthslong delay
events.description: Tanzania‚Äôs opposition leader charged with treason has appeared in court for the first time in months

events.title: Bhumjaithai Party's election victory signals shift in Thailand's politics
events.description: Thailand‚Äôs political scene is shifting as the conservative Bhumjaithai Party wins a decisive election victory

events.title: Animals dying in Kenya as drought conditions leave many hungry
events.description: Drought conditions have left over 2 million people facing hunger in parts of Kenya

events.title: What to know about Takaichi's conservative policies after big election win
events.description: Japanese Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi‚Äôs big election win paves the way for her ruling party to dominate the crucial lower house of parliament

events.title: Iraq executes a former senior officer under Saddam for the 1980 killing of a Shiite cleric
events.description: Iraq says a high-level officer during Saddam Hussein's rule has been hanged for his involvement in the 1980 killing of a prominent Shiite cleric

events.title: DR Congo: UN vows orderly peacekeeping transition as South Africa withdraws troops
events.description: South Africa has moved to withdraw its peacekeepers deployed at the United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in the Democratic Republic of the Congo (MONUSCO) after nearly three decades of service.

events.title: Fatwas, faith and fallacies: Myth-busting female genital mutilation in Africa
events.description: Olivia Albert, 19, was subjected to female genital (FGM) mutilation when she was 14. She told the UN sexual and reproductive health agency (UNFPA) that she hid her pain because everyone around her said it was normal.

events.title: Minnesota woman sentenced to prison for $325K SNAP fraud scheme
events.description: A Minnesota woman was sentenced to prison for $325,000 SNAP fraud scheme involving fake identities and pregnancy claims to steal government benefits illegally.

events.title: Nancy Guthrie's church prays God would 'guide the authorities' in search
events.description: Nancy Guthrie's Arizona church prayed for her safe return on Sunday, as Savannah Guthrie and other family members addressed alleged kidnappers in a video.

events.title: Bad Bunny's halftime show ripped for suspected political message and more top headlines
events.description: No description available.

events.title: Bishop Ronald Hicks replaces Dolan as Archbishop of New York with installation at St Patrick's
events.description: New York Archbishop Ronald Hicks officially installed at St. Patrick's Cathedral, taking over the helm after Cardinal Timothy Dolan's retirement.

events.title: 'White saviors'' use of whistles causes bitter internal rift inside anti-ICE movement
events.description: No description available.

events.title: Venezuelan opposition leader seized by armed men after being released from jail
events.description: Mar√≠a Corina Machado said Venezuelan opposition leader Juan Pablo Guanipa was seized by armed men in Caracas after his release from prison.

events.title: Keir Starmer‚Äôs chief of staff resigns after recommending Epstein-connected ambassador
events.description: Morgan McSweeney resigns as Starmer's chief of staff amid criticism over Peter Mandelson's UK ambassador appointment linked to Jeffrey Epstein connections.

events.title: Trump's special envoy Witkoff and Kushner visit US aircraft carrier amid Iran tensions, talks
events.description: Trump envoy Witkoff and Jared Kushner visited the USS Abraham Lincoln amid Iran tensions as Netanyahu prepares a Washington meeting to discuss limiting Tehran's ballistic missiles.

events.title: Iran's Khamenei stays away from talks as JD Vance says dynamic makes diplomacy 'much more complicated'
events.description: Vice President JD Vance calls Iran diplomacy "bizarre" as Supreme Leader Khamenei stays away from negotiations starting starting on Friday in Oman, complicating U.S.-Iran talks.
